name: treatment of bagasse, from sugarcane, in heat and power co-generation unit, 6400kW thermal | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26850/documentation

Treatment of bagasse, from sugarcane by combustion in a  heat and power cogeneration unit. Emission factors have been used from dataset "heat and power co-generation, wood chips, 6400kW thermal" . Emissions of CO2 and CO are based on carbon content of bagasse. Electricity and heat generation are based on lower heating value of bagasse and efficiency of the cogen unit.;The production volume of this activity is the sum of the corresonding regional activities (in Brazil and Colombia) as no Rest of the World dataset was deemed necessary for this activity.;[Dataset to be replaced by 'treatment of bagasse, from sugarcane, in heat and power co-generation unit, 6400kW thermal, BR-Mid-western grid, 2014 - 2017' (12a3dcfe-5d74-4a13-8686-fc23012d517d)]

From reception of bagasse at the cogeneration plant

This module describes the combustion of bagasse, from sugarcane. Included are the infrastructure, the bagasse input, the emissions to air and the disposal of the ashes. Also included are substances needed for operation: lubricating oil, ammonia, organic chemicals, sodium chloride, chlorine and decarbonized water.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply
tags: Sector: Waste Treatment & Recycling; Heat; Electricity

processDocumentation.timeDescription: based on dataset wood chips, burned in cogen 6400 kWh
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: based on geography of dataset for cane sugar production with ethanol by-product, that also includes burning of bagasse
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: based on dataset wood chips, burned in cogen 6400 kWh
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The original dataset is valid is based on measures from one cogen unit in Switzerland and has been extrapolated to an Indian dataset

exchanges.description: Heat production is calculated based on heat efficiency of cogen unit (77%), lower calorific value of bagasse (15.4 MJ/kg dry mass) and dry mass of bagasse (0.787 w/w)

exchanges.description:
It is assumed that all carbon content in bagasse leaves the system as emissions (CO and CO2) and ash (wood ash). The CO2 emissions are calculated by substracting the amount of C in the bagasse to the amount of carbon that leaves the system as CO (7mg/MJend) and ash (1.2E-3kg/kg ash). The rest of C is assumed to leave the system as CO2. The calculations are done using the molecular weight (MW) and carbon content with the following steps:

mass of C in input bagasse=(0.34864kgC/1kg bagasse)* mass input bagasse
mass of C as CO = output emissions CO (kg) * MWC / MWCO 
mass of C as ash = carbon content in ash (kg/kg) * output ash (kg)
emissions of C as CO2= mass of C in input bagasse - mass of C as CO - mass of C in ash
emissions of CO2=emissions of C as CO2 * (MW CO2/MW C)

Note: molecular weight of C is 12 g/mol

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
The demanded infrastructure is calculated as:

demanded infrastrucutre (unit/MJend) = MJend energy (MJ)/(capacity utilzation rate * Lifetime (y) * capacity (MJ/unit*y)

The capacity for the cogen unit is 4,67E7 MJ/y. The lifetime is 20 years. The capacity utilization rate is 0.85.
EcoSpold01Location=CH
